intro: Selago alliodora, commonly known as the fragrant selago, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
